result.title: D7.9 Mobility of staff
result.description: Mobility of students staff is a key issue in the project The strong focus on modelling activities and of the assembling and reuse of existing data in the project gives good opportunities for this kind of activities and partners are strongly encouraged to undertake exchanges within the Beacon programme Most of the partners within the project are ready to receive staff from the other partners In particular where synergies are identified by the crosscutting theme coordinator exchanges of students and staff are encouraged The target is to enable personnel to gain experience of working in different cultures types of organisations and gain appreciation of other scientific aspects of the project This forms an important aspect of the professional development offering to the Beacon project partners The key target group for the staff exchange is PhD students involved in the project at the different European universities The following staff exchanges are already planned by the partnersVTT Finland and LEI Lithuania will each visit the partner institute for at least two weeks within WP5 to couple expertise and training of junior researchers or PhD students in COMSOL modelling work ICL will host visiting lectures from Beacon partners which are open to students staff and general civil engineering industry to crossfertilise ideas and future collaboration This is relevant for all working WPsICL also have tradition and experience of hosting visiting PhD students academics or postdocs who wish to use their experimental and computational facilities to conduct some aspects of their research This is foreseen to be offered as a training possibility and mobility measure in Beacon This is relevant for all working WPs

result.title: Mid requirements & specifications for Use case 3: Deployment of digital cognitive architecture in non-ferrous industrial case
result.description: As a result of the deep analysis of the status and innovation potential by elevating the overall degree of digitalization in terms of instrumentation equipment data collection data analysis and control technology for Use case 3 Deployment of digital cognitive architecture in nonferrous industrial case the requirements and specifications for Use case 3 will be issued in Deliverable D25 in M6 This will be a first approach for developing process improvements in terms of energy efficiency minimizing waste environmental aspects product quality and productivity
